intro: Tetraplasandra sherffii, commonly known as the Kauri fig, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in humid, temperate climates and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a conservation priority in its native habitat.
